sourcing.instructions: B (Boron): Chemical supply companies; Cr (Chromium): Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron): Hardware stores; Nb (Niobium): Specialty metal suppliers; W (Tungsten): Metal suppliers or online chemical retailers.
steps: B (Boron): Chemical supply companies; Cr (Chromium): Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron): Hardware stores; Nb (Niobium): Specialty metal suppliers; W (Tungsten): Metal suppliers or online chemical retailers.

1. Measure 3.00 g of Boron powder. 2. Measure 1.00 g of Chromium powder. 3. Measure 2.00 g of Iron powder. 4. Measure 2.00 g of Niobium powder. 5. Measure 1.00 g of Tungsten powder. 6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 7. Use a spatula to thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 3.00 g of Boron powder. 2. Measure 1.00 g of Chromium powder. 3. Measure 2.00 g of Iron powder. 4. Measure 2.00 g of Niobium powder. 5. Measure 1.00 g of Tungsten powder. 6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 7. Use a spatula to thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 1200 °C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 1200 °C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Remove the cooled alloy from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the required dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface from oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the cooled alloy from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the required dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface from oxidation.
